description: From Curie (“a surname”) +‎ -ite, after Pierre Curie and/or his wife Marie, early researchers of radioactivity — the ore being radioactive due to its uranium.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) An orthorhombic-dipyramidal mineral containing hydrogen, lead, oxygen, and uranium.
examples: The present note relates to the behaviour of uranium minerals such as uraninite, curite, and uranophane in high-tension separators.
